column4: does the live cd use /etc/X11/xorg.conf?  doesnt seem like it.  i need to add some modelines.
you can create an xorg.conf and restart X
the reason there's no xorg.conf is that things can be configured on the fly now :) check out the wiki page
by default, no. it's been unnecessary for 3 years
oh wow.  so much has changed since i used linux for home use i.e. a gui
i generated a config and placed it in X11.  i guess if it's not set to read the config, it wont.
oh well.  this is good news.  should be easier to play w/ the resolution on my tv.  :)
what did they do to x to eliminate the need for xorg.conf?  is it something fundamental you can describe in a sentence?

it gained the ability to ask the monitor "so, what resolutions & refresh rates do you support?" and just automatically try the highest.  granted, some monitors *lie* about what they support...and that's when you do what the wiki page says and add modes
are we talking support for edid?
is there a command to easily pull edid?  id like to see what this tv says.
umm... if you type `xrandr` all by itself it'll tell you what X has available to it
